page.title: 20The School.
page.content: In{1864,}when our school was built,it only had one classroom though there were more children then.{Today}there are{34;then}there were{58.}The infants and juniors used to be separated by a screen.The teacher,Miss Grainger,lived in the schoolhouse and there was a door going from the classroom to her house.Mrs.Williams,the caretaker,lives there now.We work in two new class- rooms,built on the playground a few years ago.Miss Watson teaches the in- fants,Mrs.Dunning teaches the juniors. In September Mrs.Rochelle will be the new head.Our dinners come by ambulance from Ford school.We eat them in the Victory Hall across the yard. Mrs. Whittle looks after us at dinner time. We go to Wattlesborough for games on Friday afternoon.Our Mums take us by car.When we leave this school we go to Mary Webb school,Pontesbury.
